entry.title: Prevent workflows from being approved after a certain date
entry.content:
Hi,

We use workflow approvals to manage time-off.
We currently have a rule to prevent submission before a certain date (Using Rules attached to the time type).

Problem is, managers are approving workflows for days requested in the past, where payroll for that period already closed.

For example, say you want a week off from September 1st until September 7th.  That payroll period is currently open...
So they will be able to submit the time-off and create the workflow just fine.

The problem comes when a manager approves this but it's too late.... for example, If the manager approves this on September 2nd, this will be late for payroll, as on September 2nd, the pay period is already closed.

Is there any way to prevent a Workflow from being approved after a certain date?

entry.title: SAP SuccessFactors Reporting - Aggregated Columns Label Field Issue
entry.content:
Hi Folks,

I am writing this to raise a flag about an issue with the Reporting Tool in SAP SuccessFactors .  When field labels are used in Aggregated columns Filters, the Error getting Preview issue is raised and the Report doesn't produce any results. The Report works as expected when the same field with Name is used. Requesting the Reporting Team to work on this and provide with a fix to have consistent behavior with all the fields when used in the filters.

entry.title: Receiving CompetencyMigrationFailuresCheck when Language is Deactivated
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We have JDM 1.0 and Competency Library 2.1 with 9 languages. Among them are Spanish (Spain) and Spanish (Mexico) languages, but we disabled the Spanish (Spain) as we don't want to use it.

Recently we updated our JDM 1.0 to JPB and found that we are receiving an error when we run Check Tool on JPB post migration. The error shows as CompetencyMigrationFailuresCheck. And this shows all the Spanish (Spain) translation as errors.

But, when we enable Spanish (Spain) language in the system, and run the check tool, then were no errors popped up and the check tool says No issues found.

This behavior seems to be not as expected. Why the Check Tool shows above error when we disable Spanish (Spain) language but No issues when we enable Spanish (Spain) language.

Appreciate if any guidance on it. Please let us know if any one faced this type of issue  or how they fixed it.

Regards,
Balaji

entry.title: Position To Job Sync through Data Loader API creating blank Job Relationship record
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I am currently facing a setback in SuccessFactors Employee Central with an API transaction in Job Information.

Scenario:  DATA Loader is being used to update Job Information for employees. While doing a Job information update for an employee (let's say we create a blank data change record in the Job Information with today's date).  After uploading, a blank record gets created in Job Information with Data Change as event reason (AS EXPECTED), but a blank Job relationship record is also getting created with the same effective date.
As per rule trace, the Position to Job Sync rule is getting triggered and e due to the different "Set" Job Relationship Matrix rules, Job Relationship portlet is getting affected and creating blank records even if there no change in Position Matrix relationships.

Is there any workaround where the API profile can be made to identify that this data loader update will only trigger Job Information and not Job Relationship if there is no change in Matrix relationships?

Thanks,
Rigjit Banerjee

entry.title: Count 14 consecutive days of clocked-in
entry.content:
Hello Experts!

Would you know if it is possible (and how) can we manage to count the number of consecutive days the employee has clocked in for work? We have a customer requirement to raise an Alert and Warning if the employee has clocked in for more than 14 days consecutively.

I tried to configure it but the count resets every week, since 14 days crosses two weeks.

I have an idea but not sure if this will work (week numbers are not necessarily the specific week of the month):

Week 1 - 3 consecutive days (count for container 1)

week 2 - 7 consecutive days (count for container2)

week 3 - 4 consecutive days (count for container3)

if employee clocks in on 5th day of 3rd week system should raise an alert..

Not sure if it is possible to verify consecutive weeks (containers as above).
